Welcome to Viya 3.4 Custom Authorization’s documentation!¶

customize_authorization.customize_authorization.main()¶

Update configuration settings based on command-line parameters, then proceed to parse the custom authorization groups file and make any necessary changes - such as creating new custom groups and managing the membership of existing custom groups.

customize_authorization.argument_helper.parse_arguments()¶

This method leverages the argparse module to optionally modify the script’s configuration variables at run-time.

customize_authorization.oath_helper.get_oauth_token()¶

Use the sas-admin CLI to generate a bearer token for a user profile on a SAS Viya services node, then parse it out of the credentials.json file.

oath_token:

A bearer token to be used in an HTTP request’s authorization header.

customize_authorization.logger.get_timestamp_by_minute()¶

Generate a timestamp string with the following format: YYYY-MM-DD_HH-MM

customize_authorization.logger.get_timestamp_by_second()¶

Generate a timestamp string with the following format: YYYY-MM-DD_HH-MM-SS

customize_authorization.logger.log(message)¶

Write a message to a log file, named by the current date + minute combination.

message:

The message to log.

customize_authorization.rest_api_helper.call_rest_api(request_value, request_type, **kwargs)¶

Execute an HTTP request against a SAS REST API. In this case, the API in question will always be the Identities API.

request_value:

An API endpoint.

request_type:

An HTTP request type, i.e. ‘get’, ‘put’, ‘head’, etc.

kwargs:

A dictionary of key-value pairs, including data, which contains the request body.

The HTTP response from the API endpoint.

customize_authorization.rest_api_helper.check_ldap_group_existence(group_id)¶

Query the SAS Identities API to determine if an LDAP group exists or not.

group_id:

The ID of the LDAP group of interest.

A boolean flag.

customize_authorization.rest_api_helper.create_group(group_id, group_name)¶

Use the SAS Identities API to create a custom group object.

group_id:

The ID of the LDAP group being created.

group_name:

The name of the LDAP group being created.

customize_authorization.rest_api_helper.get_all_ldap_group_users(group_id)¶

Query the SAS Identities API to retrieve all users contained within an LDAP group object’s member tree.

group_id:

The ID of the LDAP group to retrieve users from.

users:

A JSON array of user objects.

customize_authorization.rest_api_helper.modify_group_membership(http_method, group_id, user_id)¶

Modify the membership of an existing group (LDAP or custom).

http_method:

Either ‘put’ or ‘delete’ for addition or deletion, respectively.

group_id:

The ID of the group being modified.

user_id:

The ID of the user being added or removed.
